New Records: Golden State Warriors took the opener of the two-day, two-game series 124-106.
Golden State Warriors pulled away from the visiting New Orleans Pelicans for a 104-89 victory.
Key Match Events: Buddy Hield had 21 points to lead six scorers in double figures.
Brandin Podziemski nearly recorded a triple-double as Stephen Curry’s replacement.
Trayce Jackson-Davis added 15 points and nine rebounds.
Jordan Hawkins put up a game-high 23 points for New Orleans.
Pre-Game Insights: Stephen Curry sprained his left ankle on Sunday, and Brandin Podziemski started in his place.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State took a 13-point lead into the fourth quarter, then scored 12 of the period’s first 17 points to create a 91-71 cushion with seven minutes to play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Golden State Warriors shot 47.1 percent as a team.
The Pelicans finished at just 36.7 percent.
Even top scorer Hawkins went just 9-for-21.
Others: Zion Williamson collected 12 rebounds to complement 12 points for New Orleans.
Jose Alvarado had 16 points and Ingram 14 to go with six assists.
